snippet: Toni Preckwinkle, president of the Cook County Board of Commissioners, is seeking to save $6 million next year by reducing the populations of the county’s jail and juvenile detention center.
lead_paragraph: Toni Preckwinkle, president of the Cook County Board of Commissioners, is seeking to save $6 million next year by reducing the populations of the county’s jail and juvenile detention center.

headline.main: Jailing Fewer Would Trim County Costs, Official Says
headline.seo: Reducing Jail Rolls Would Trim Cook County Costs, Preckwinkle Says
headline.print_headline: Jailing Fewer Would Trim County Costs, Official Says
